intro: Noccaea cochlearioides, commonly known as the kidneyweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive kidney-shaped seeds. Noccaea cochlearioides is an annual or biennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with the right conditions.
